title: Murud-Janjira Fort
subtitle: The Invincible Sea Fort of Maharashtra
overview: Murud-Janjira Fort is one of the strongest marine forts in India, located on an island off the coastal village of Murud in Raigad district. Built by the Siddis in the 15th century, this impregnable fort stood unconquered through attacks by the Portuguese, British, and Marathas.
The name ‘Janjira’ is derived from the Arabic word ‘Jazeera’, meaning island. Surrounded by the Arabian Sea, it remains a remarkable example of ancient naval architecture and maritime defense.

highlights.title: Unconquered Sea Fort
highlights.description: Despite numerous attacks by the British and Marathas, Murud-Janjira was never defeated.

highlights.title: Island Fortress
highlights.description: Completely surrounded by the Arabian Sea, accessible only by sailboats.

geography.intro: Murud-Janjira Fort stands proudly in the Arabian Sea, about 2 km off the coastal village of Murud. The oval-shaped island fort covers an area of nearly 22 acres and rises majestically above the waves.

details.label: Key Features
details.value: Massive bastions, freshwater ponds, canons, palace ruins

climate.description: Murud experiences a tropical coastal climate with moderate temperatures and high humidity year-round.

seasons.text: Ideal to visit between November and February.
Avoid visiting during the monsoon season (June–September) due to rough sea conditions.

geography.conclusion: Set amidst the sea’s waves, Murud-Janjira remains one of Maharashtra’s most awe-inspiring maritime landmarks.

activities.title: Boat Ride to the Fort
activities.description: Enjoy an exciting sailboat ride from Rajapuri jetty to reach the fort.
info: Boat rides operate only in calm sea conditions.

activities.title: Historical Exploration
activities.description: Wander through palace ruins, secret escape routes, and old cannons.
info: Hire a local guide for historical insights.
Carry water and sun protection for the island visit.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture panoramic views of the sea, fort walls, and ancient architecture.

attractions.title: Three Mighty Cannons
attractions.description: Kalal Bangdi, Landa Kasam, and Chavri are massive cannons that once guarded the fort.

attractions.title: Palace Ruins & Water Tanks
attractions.description: Remains of royal palaces, secret passages, and freshwater ponds within the fort.

marineLife.intro: Located in the Arabian Sea, the area around Janjira supports a rich marine ecosystem with calm tidal zones and mangrove regions near the coast.

items.title: Fish and Crustaceans
items.description: Waters around Murud are known for species like mackerel, pomfret, and prawns.

items.title: Marine Biodiversity
items.description: The sea around Janjira sustains coral rocks, small reefs, and mangrove vegetation.

conclusion: Murud-Janjira’s marine surroundings add natural beauty to its historical significance.
Boat rides also offer glimpses of sea birds and playful waves near the fort.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Murud is around 165 km from Mumbai via Alibag and Revdanda.
State transport buses and private taxis are easily available.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: The nearest railway station is Roha (40 km).
Taxis and buses connect Roha to Murud village.

howToReach.title: By Sea
details: Ferries operate from Gateway of India to Mandwa, then drive to Murud (around 55 km).
Local sailboats take you to the fort from Rajapuri Jetty.

bookingTips.description: Visit early morning to avoid long queues for boat rides.
Carry life jackets and follow safety instructions during the sea journey.
Protect electronic gadgets from seawater spray.
